ds1307.docs:
You first need to set up the [I2C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html) component.

*See also: [DS1307 Time Source](https://esphome.io/components/time/ds1307.html#ds1307-time-source)*

gps.docs:
You first need to set up the [GPS](https://esphome.io/components/gps.html) component.

*See also: [GPS Time Source](https://esphome.io/components/time/gps.html#gps-time-source)*

homeassistant.docs:
The preferred way to get time in ESPHome is using Home Assistant. With the `homeassistant` time platform, the [native API](https://esphome.io/components/api.html) connection to Home Assistant will be used to periodically synchronize the current time.

*See also: [Home Assistant Time Source](https://esphome.io/components/time/homeassistant.html#home-assistant-time-source)*

pcf85063.docs:
You first need to set up the [I2C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html) component.

*See also: [PCF85063 Time Source](https://esphome.io/components/time/pcf85063.html#pcf85063-time-source)*

sntp.docs:
**list of strings**: Choose up to 3 NTP servers that are used for the clock source. Defaults to `0.pool.ntp.org`, `1.pool.ntp.org` and `2.pool.ntp.org`

*See also: [SNTP Time Source](https://esphome.io/components/time/sntp.html#sntp-time-source)*

timezone.docs:
**string**: Manually tell ESPHome what time zone to use with [this format](https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/TZ-Variable.html) (warning: the format is quite complicated, see [examples](https://github.com/nayarsystems/posix_tz_db/blob/master/zones.csv)) or the simpler [TZ database name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) in the form `<Region>/<City>`. ESPHome tries to automatically infer the time zone string based on the time zone of the computer that is running ESPHome, but this might not always be accurate.

*See also: [Time Component](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#configuration-variables)*

seconds.docs:
**string**: Specify for which seconds of the minute the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all seconds). Range is from 0 to 59.

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

minutes.docs:
**string**: Specify for which minutes of the hour the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all minutes). Range is from 0 to 59.

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

hours.docs:
**string**: Specify for which hours of the day the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all hours). Range is from 0 to 23.

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_month.docs:
**string**: Specify for which days of the month the automation will trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). Range is from 1 to 31.

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

months.docs:
**string**: Specify for which months of the year to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all months). The month names JAN to DEC are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (January) to 12 (December).

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

days_of_week.docs:
**string**: Specify for which days of the week to trigger. Defaults to `*` (all days). The names SUN to SAT are automatically substituted. Range is from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday).

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

cron.docs:
**string**: Alternatively, you can specify a whole cron expression like `* /5 * * * *`. Please note that years and some special characters like `L`, `#` are currently not supported. Also, the day of week field is interpreted like the **days_of_week** variable (range from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday)) and not like other cron implementations would do it (range from 0 (Sunday) to 7 (Sunday)).

*See also: [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#on-time-trigger)*

on_time.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: Automation to run at specific intervals using a cron-like syntax. See [on_time Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#time-on-time).

*See also: [Time Component](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#configuration-variables)*

on_time_sync.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: Automation to run when the time source could be (re-)synchronized.. See [on_time_sync Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#time-on-time-sync).

*See also: [Time Component](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Specify the ID of the time for use in lambdas.

*See also: [Time Component](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#configuration-variables)*

has_time.docs:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if time has been set and is valid.

*See also: [`time.has_time` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/time/index.html#time-has-time-condition)*
